text: Earnings rose at least 5.0 percent over the year in 7 states and the District of Columbia.
32 states had June unemployment rates at or below the national rate of 3.7 percent.
Only Arizona saw total employment increase more than 3.0 percent over the year.
Public employment declined over the year in 13 states and the District of Columbia.
Unemployment reached a decade-low level for 21 states in June 2019.
